organization.title: Area of Occupancy (AOO)
organization.text: AOO applies to criteria A, B, and D

organization.title: Extent of Occurrence (EOO)
organization.text: EOO applies to criteria A and B

organization.title: Very restricted AOO or number locations VU (D2)
organization.information: Population with a very restricted area of occupancy (typically less than 20km2) or number of locations (typically five or fewer) such that it is prone to the effects of human activities or stochastic events within a very short time period in an uncertain future, and is thus capable of becoming Critically Engangered or even Extinct in a very short time period.

organization.title: Elevation / Depth / Depth Zones
organization.text: Elevation Limits
Depth Limits
Depth Zones

organization.title: Countries of Occurrence
organization.information: When using Quick-Add, please ensure you also select the appropriate country-level for each subcountry unit.

organization.title: Large Marine Ecosystems (LME) Occurrence
organization.information: When using Quick-Add, please ensure you also select the appropriate ecosystem-level for each subecosystem unit.

organization.title: FAO Area Occurrence
organization.information: When using Quick-Add, please ensure you also select the appropriate area-level for each subarea unit.

organization.title: Population Information
organization.text: Population Size information applies to criteria A, B, C and D
Subpopulation size information applies to criteria B and C

organization.title: Population Reduction - Past
organization.text: A population size reduction in the past 10 years or 3 generations, whichever is the longer, up to a maximum of 100 years

organization.title: Population Reduction - Future
organization.text: A population size reduction projected or suspected to be met within the next 10 years or 3 generations, whichever is the longer, up to a maximum of 100 years

organization.title: Population Reduction - Ongoing
organization.text: A population size reduction over any 10 year or three generation period, whichever is longer (up to a maximum of 100 years in the future), where the time period must include both the past and the future

organization.title: Life History
organization.text: Generation Length
